page.title: 02Local History
page.content: Tower Bridge attracts many visitors especially as you can now walk along the highest level. London Bridge is new; the old one was sold to the United States a few years ago. Some places are not so famous but just as interesting. Saint Dunstan in the East is an old church badly damaged in 1941 during the Blitz. It was not rebuilt, but the Worshipful Company of Gardeners has planted many flowers and trees; the small chapel is still open for silent prayer. Some guilds are still thriving like the Watermen's Guild in St.Mary-at-Hill. Occasionally you can see metal studs in the pavement. These show that the ground belongs to the owners of the adjoining building.
